html: Today is #EqualPayDay. That means if a man and a woman each start working on Jan. 1, 2018, what the man is paid by the end of Dec. 2018 wouldn't be paid to the woman until today – April 2, 2019! And it means that it takes 15 months for women to receive what men make in a year!pic.twitter.com/b71J4cZvx2
text: Today is #EqualPayDay. That means if a man and a woman each start working on Jan. 1, 2018, what the man is paid by the end of Dec. 2018 wouldn't be paid to the woman until today – April 2, 2019! And it means that it takes 15 months for women to receive what men make in a year!pic.twitter.com/b71J4cZvx2

html: I say this to the President, and his defenders in Congress: You may think it’s okay how Trump and his associates interacted with Russians during the campaign. I don’t. I think it’s immoral. I think it’s unethical. I think it’s unpatriotic. And yes, I think it’s corrupt.pic.twitter.com/nTdgRVfssQ
text:
I say this to the President, and his defenders in Congress:

You may think it’s okay how Trump and his associates interacted with Russians during the campaign.

I don’t.

I think it’s immoral. I think it’s unethical. I think it’s unpatriotic. And yes, I think it’s corrupt.pic.twitter.com/nTdgRVfssQ

html: The House just passed HR 1, a historic bill to give power back to the people! Limiting influence of $$ in our elections Expanding access to the ballot box Prohibiting voter roll purges & ending partisan gerrymandering THIS is what Democracy looks like! #ForThePeople
text:
The House just passed HR 1, a historic bill to give power back to the people!
 
 Limiting influence of $$ in our elections
 Expanding access to the ballot box
 Prohibiting voter roll purges & ending partisan gerrymandering
 
THIS is what Democracy looks like! #ForThePeople

html: On #BloodySunday – March 7, 1965 – everyday Americans, Foot Soldiers and Civil Rights leaders set out from Brown Chapel to march across the Edmund Pettus Bridge towards Montgomery, where state troopers attacked the nonviolent marchers with billy clubs and tear gas.pic.twitter.com/PWPHev3QKc

html: If Alabama expands Medicaid, we could bring back $2 billion Alabama taxpayer dollars, provide 360,000 Alabamians with health care, and shore up rural hospitals and their local economies. The choice is clear!
text: If Alabama expands Medicaid, we could bring back $2 billion Alabama taxpayer dollars, provide 360,000 Alabamians with health care, and shore up rural hospitals and their local economies. The choice is clear!

html: 88% of rural AL hospitals are operating in the red. 13 AL hospitals – 7 in rural areas – have closed since 2011. These hospitals provide critical care and jobs for hundreds of Alabamians. Gov. Ivey must #ExpandMedicaid now to help our struggling hospitals!https://www.al.com/life/2019/03/ceos-for-rural-hospitals-join-sen-jones-rep-sewell-on-medicaid.html …

html: Today in #BlackHistoryMonth, I’m recognizing Mobile native Alexis Herman, the first African-American Secretary of Labor! html: Today in #BlackHistoryMonth I’m recognizing Johnnie Carr, a #shero from Montgomery who never stopped fighting for equality. html: Voting is the cornerstone of our democracy. Everything starts with the vote – representation, districting & policies that impact every single American. text:

html: A strong democracy removes barriers and improves access, so EVERY citizen can vote. We MUST restore the VRA and #RestoreTheVote
text:
A strong democracy removes barriers and improves access, so EVERY citizen can vote.

We MUST restore the VRA and #RestoreTheVote

html: That’s why 207 of my House colleagues and I are introducing legislation today to #RestoreTheVote by putting the teeth back into the Voting Rights Act of 1965.
text: That’s why 207 of my House colleagues and I are introducing legislation today to #RestoreTheVote by putting the teeth back into the Voting Rights Act of 1965.

html: Since the Supreme Court’s Shelby decision, changes to some state voting laws are leading the United States in the wrong direction. When Americans are not able to cast their ballot, their voices are left behind. #RestoreTheVote
text: Since the Supreme Court’s Shelby decision, changes to some state voting laws are leading the United States in the wrong direction. When Americans are not able to cast their ballot, their voices are left behind. #RestoreTheVote

html: During WWII, African Americans in many states were still subject to discriminatory Jim Crow laws and the American military was racially segregated, but the airmen’s impressive combat record and achievements paved the way for full integration of the US military. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/iMnBiANv47
text: During WWII, African Americans in many states were still subject to discriminatory Jim Crow laws and the American military was racially segregated, but the airmen’s impressive combat record and achievements paved the way for full integration of the US military. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/iMnBiANv47

html: Today in #BlackHistoryMonth, I’m highlighting the great Tuskegee Airmen! They were the first African-American military aviators in the U.S. Armed Forces and some of the best pilots in the U.S. Army Air Forces.pic.twitter.com/b3GKTOx7px
text: Today in #BlackHistoryMonth, I’m highlighting the great Tuskegee Airmen! They were the first African-American military aviators in the U.S. Armed Forces and some of the best pilots in the U.S. Army Air Forces.pic.twitter.com/b3GKTOx7px

html: Dr. Juanakee Adams is the first African-American female optometrist to practice in Alabama. Living by the saying "unto much is given, much is required," Dr. Adams gives back by mentoring young optometrists as they launch their careers. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/8LREel9e7l

html: Next week, I will introduce HR 4, the Voting Rights Advancement Act, to help address the most egregious forms of voter suppression, like GA saw in Nov 2018 when the Republican candidate for gov put 53,000 voter registrations on hold, nearly 70% of which belonged to black voters.pic.twitter.com/ADTWsFYieo

html: Joe Louis, known as the “Brown Bomber,” was one of the best heavyweight boxers of all time. He reigned as the world heavyweight champion from 1937 to 1949 and had a career record of 66 wins and 3 losses! #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/7oj39Ns3yJ

html: The lead perpetrator – a Klan leader who boasted about his role – was not brought to justice for more than 10 years after the bombing. Nearly 40 years later, @SenDougJones prosecuted the two remaining suspects. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/ZjrsYGjQFV

html: The bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church was the third in 11 days after a federal court order had come down mandating the integration of Alabama’s school system. #BlackHistoryMonth

html: At 10:22 a.m. on the morning of September 15, 1963, Addie Mae Collins, Cynthia Wesley, Carole Robertson and Denise McNair were killed by white supremacists who bombed Birmingham’s 16th Street Baptist Church. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/MEsdTXHT1q

html: Daniel "Chappie" James Jr. was an American fighter pilot in the Air Force, who became the first African American General to pin on four stars. He was a product of Alabama's Tuskegee Institute and instructed the legendary Tuskegee Airmen during World War II. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/9ufUCjySTx

html: Alice Coachman Davis was the first black woman to win an Olympic gold medal! Davis had to overcome many disadvantages growing up under discriminatory Jim Crow laws, but persevered and captured high jump gold in 1948. #BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/yQoMG0fJhb
text:
Alice Coachman Davis was the first black woman to win an Olympic gold medal! Davis had to overcome many disadvantages growing up under discriminatory Jim Crow laws, but persevered and captured high jump gold in 1948. 

#BlackHistoryMonthpic.twitter.com/yQoMG0fJhb

html: Women in AL are paid 76 cents for every dollar paid to men. The gender wage gap in AL is projected to close in 2089. AL women working full time lose more than $11B a year due to the wage gap. It's time to ensure women get equal pay for equal work.https://www.al.com/opinion/2019/01/10-years-after-lilly-ledbetter-act-fair-pay-still-lags.html …
text:
Women in AL are paid 76 cents for every dollar paid to men. 

The gender wage gap in AL is projected to close in 2089. 

AL women working full time lose more than $11B a year due to the wage gap. 

It's time to ensure women get equal pay for equal work.https://www.al.com/opinion/2019/01/10-years-after-lilly-ledbetter-act-fair-pay-still-lags.html …

html: To be clear, it is never a good idea to shutdown govt over policy disputes. The American people deserve better. I look forward to working in a bipartisan way to pass funding bills that reflect our shared values, respect our workers and invest in effective border security.
text: To be clear, it is never a good idea to shutdown govt over policy disputes. The American people deserve better. I look forward to working in a bipartisan way to pass funding bills that reflect our shared values, respect our workers and invest in effective border security.

html: For 35 days, Pres. Trump’s govt shutdown has caused undue financial hardships on thousands of federal workers while inflicting needless pain on all Americans. While I’m glad POTUS finally re-opened govt today, it is never a good idea to shutdown govt over policy disagreements.

We need funding for teacher pay, health care, for job skills training and access to higher ed. We need funding for roads, bridges, water and wastewater systems.

Shutting down the government over funding for a wall that the public doesn't want is disgraceful. Plain and simple.

I have called for:
—Complete disclosure of all documents
—Subpoena Mark Judge
—Postpone the vote
Dr. Ford was credible & courageous.

The message I will send is this—I vote no. #RightSideofHistory

html: We’ve seen so much damage in PR and VI, and here’s the sad truth- the strength of last year’s hurricanes was a result of climate change. html: It's been 369 days since @RepTerriSewell introduced legislation to restore the Voting Rights Act, which the Supreme Court gutted 5 years ago today. Use #RestoreTheVote at 3pm ET to join a twitter storm demanding action. We cannot be silent.pic.twitter.com/9BCqM4MN0i
text:
It's been 369 days since @RepTerriSewell introduced legislation to restore the Voting Rights Act, which the Supreme Court gutted 5 years ago today.

Use #RestoreTheVote at 3pm ET to join a twitter storm demanding action. We cannot be silent.pic.twitter.com/9BCqM4MN0i

html: The Voting Rights Advancement Act ensures that states with repeated voting rights violations are required to clear their election changes with the Department of Justice. That’s a commonsense voter protection to keep our elections fair. #RestoreTheVOTE #RestoreTheVRApic.twitter.com/W5E0mOOOmt
text:
The Voting Rights Advancement Act ensures that states with repeated voting rights violations are required to clear their election changes with the Department of Justice. That’s a commonsense voter protection to keep our elections fair.
#RestoreTheVOTE
#RestoreTheVRApic.twitter.com/W5E0mOOOmt

html: 5 years after SCOTUS gutted the Voting Rights Act, our right to a fair voice in our democracy is under attack. 23 states have enacted voter ID laws, 6 states have reduced early voting and 7 states have created new barriers to registration. Congress: it's time to #RestoreTheVote.https://twitter.com/DemAwakening/status/1011324186122424321 …
text:
5 years after SCOTUS gutted the Voting Rights Act, our right to a fair voice in our democracy is under attack. 23 states have enacted voter ID laws, 6 states have reduced early voting and 7 states have created new barriers to registration.

Congress: it's time to #RestoreTheVote.https://twitter.com/DemAwakening/status/1011324186122424321 …

html: Today, #Juneteenth, marks the anniversary of the end of slavery in the U.S. – the day slaves in Galveston were finally freed two years after the Emancipation Proclamation. Today we celebrate how far we’ve come since that moment, and acknowledge how far we have to go.pic.twitter.com/D1yrKkOKNi
text: Today, #Juneteenth, marks the anniversary of the end of slavery in the U.S.  – the day slaves in Galveston were finally freed two years after the Emancipation Proclamation. html: President Trump’s reckless withdrawal from the #IranDeal has the potential to destabilize an already unstable region. Unilaterally walking away from this agreement leaves America isolated and puts our national security at risk! Terrible decision.
text: President Trump’s reckless withdrawal from the #IranDeal has the potential to destabilize an already unstable region. Unilaterally walking away from this agreement leaves America isolated and puts our national security at risk! Terrible decision.

html: After months of conversations with nuclear experts, military officials, and constituent groups, I decided to support the #IranDeal because it was our best option for ensuring a nuclear-free Iran. It wasn't perfect, but collective enforcement made it the best path forward.
text: After months of conversations with nuclear experts, military officials, and constituent groups, I decided to support the #IranDeal because it was our best option for ensuring a nuclear-free Iran. It wasn't perfect, but collective enforcement made it the best path forward.

html: It’s overwhelming to see the sheer magnitude of lynchings across the state of Alabama and across the country. These where dark times in our nation’s history and it’s a incredible to see these victims being finally acknowledged. I’m hopeful this brings about some needed healing.pic.twitter.com/ojxXEtxi6A

html: Today, I'll be in Montgomery for the unveiling of the first ever memorial to victims of lynching and racial terror in America. This Memorial finds its home in AL, where more than 300 African Americans were killed by lynching and millions more were terrorized by white supremacy.

html: As we recognize the anniversary of Flint, where state and federal support came years after the contamination of local drinking water, we have to take this opportunity to reflect on the need for immediate action to repair our water and wastewater infrastructure.pic.twitter.com/vQyscn0CYQ
